article: Senior high school life is a very new experience. Li Ruomeng, 16, a Senior 1 student at Shanghai No 8 High School, thinks that he has become more responsible  _  he began to study in an all-boys class. Li is studying in one of the first all-boys classes in Shanghai. The classes were started  _  September, 2012. Besides common subjects  such as  math and English, the all-boys classes take some special courses. They've learned how to stay safe in earthquakes and fires. Li is looking forward to courses in the mountains. "That  _  be exciting and useful. I can't wait to see if I can live by  _  From eight months of study, the students have got a lot from  special courses  and also made progress in their studies. But there are still some worries that boys in the class may be  _  to get on with girls. Lu Qisheng, the school's headmaster, doesn't agree with that. "The boys told me they have more ways to get on with  _  ," Lu told China Daily. "One boy goes to next-door classes to  _  girls stories, while another likes to show girls how to dance." The school is planning  to start  four more all-boys classes this September. "What we try to do is to help boys do their best and achieve their greatest potential ," Lu said.
